meanings.definition: To pull a plant or tree out of the ground.
meanings.sent1: I had to uproot the weeds from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The storm uprooted the old tree in our backyard.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see the squirrel try to uproot the giant oak tree.
meanings.sent4: The idea of moving to a new city can uproot one's sense of belonging.
meanings.sent5: The image of the uprooted tree stayed in my mind for days.

meanings.definition: To remove or displace someone or something from a place or position.
meanings.sent1: The construction work will uproot the residents from their homes temporarily.
meanings.sent2: The decision to uproot the old traditions caused quite a stir in the community.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to uproot the coin from thin air.
meanings.sent4: The sudden promotion uprooted her from her familiar routine.
meanings.sent5: The news of the upcoming merger uprooted the stability of the company.
